ABOUT THE MASSACHUSETTS ENERGY SAVINGS ASSISTANT (MESA)


Want to be smart about how much energy you use and money you spend on electricity, heating and cooling your home and/or workplace, and operating your vehicle? Want to be more comfortable? Want to help reduce air pollution?

The Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources (DOER)  developed this one-stop-shop so you can find what is available, whether it’s from a state agency, Mass Save®, or the federal government. DOER is responsible for developing the Commonwealth’s energy policies and programs to advance a clean, affordable and resilient energy future for Massachusetts.

We often hear that it takes a lot of time to look at different websites and find what you’re looking for. Here you will find a comprehensive list of energy incentives and rebates available to the public. With this web tool, you can search for incentives and then go directly to the information you need and the action you can take, regardless of who the sponsor is.

The Massachusetts Energy Savings Assistant (MESA)provides a single entry point to all of the energy saving opportunities available to Massachusetts residents, businesses and institutions. You can find rebates, loans and financing for electric vehicles, appliances, home energy assessments, solar electricity and far more and then go directly to the sponsor’s website.

SEARCH using your zip code and you will be guided to energy incentives and rebates in your area. You can CLICK on a link and GO directly to the program web page.

You can also search based on who you are and what you are looking for.

Who are you?
  • Resident
  • Low-income resident
  • Business/institution
  • Agricultural entity
  • Industry
  • Training and Certification
What are you looking for?
  • Appliances
  • Energy Audit
  • Lighting
  • Heating and Cooling
  • Solar Electricity
  • Electric Vehicles
  • New Construction
  • Remodeling
  • Financing
  • Renewable Power
  • Training and Certification
    • .

If you have any questions regarding a specific incentive or rebate, please contact the agency, utility or organization providing the offer.

If you have any questions on how the portal works, need assistance navigating through or want to provide feedback, please contact us by email at:DOEREnergy@State.MA.US.
